## Installation

You can install the development version of cevomod from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("pawelqs/cevomod")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(cevomod)
library(tidyverse)
data("tcga_brca_test")

tcga_brca_test |> 
  ggplot(aes(VAF, fill = sample_id, color = sample_id)) +
  stat_SFS(geom = "bar") +
  layer_mutations(drivers = "BRCA", color = "black", shape = "impact") +
  facet_wrap(~sample_id, scales = "free_y") +
  theme_ellie(n = n_distinct(tcga_brca_test$sample_id))
```
